speaker: John Edwards
vclaim: "We now have the largest income inequality since the Great Depression."
date: stated on May 12, 2007 in a story by Reuters wire service.:
title: Economists find a large income gap
text: In fact, economists have found that the upper class of Americans earn a disproportionately large percentage of income, and they have almost always had it. The income gap narrowed immediately after the Great Depression but has been escalating since then - most so in the 1980s and 1990s. An analysis of income tax revenues by Economists Emmanuel Sayes at the University of California, Berkeley and Thomas Beckett at the Paris School of Economics revealed that income reached the highest 1 per cent, doubling from 8 per cent of total labour force income in 1980 to 16 per cent in 2004, and reaching pre-repression levels in 2005. On January 13, 2021, the distinguished fact-finding bloggers announced in a story in which General David H. Berger, commander of the United States Navy, rejected Nancy Belusi's request for the use of marines for inaugural security, saying, "We are not working for you."
